intro: Cyrtochilum caquetanum, commonly known as the Caquetá orchid, is a terrestrial orchid native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its compact, leafy growth habit. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically yellow or greenish-yellow in color. Cyrtochilum caquetanum thrives in shaded, humid environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
